attributes.action: Fines should be imposed for people not obeying the highway codes 137 and 138. “Use the right-hand lane for overtaking or turning right. After overtaking, move back to the left-hand lane when it is safe to do so”.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Fines should be imposed for people not obeying the highway codes 137 and 138.

137
On a two-lane dual carriageway you should stay in the left-hand lane. Use the right-hand lane for overtaking or turning right. After overtaking, move back to the left-hand lane when it is safe to do so.

138
On a three-lane dual carriageway, you may use the middle lane or the right-hand lane to overtake but return to the middle and then the left-hand lane when it is safe.

All Motorway overhead information gantries, when not showing warnings, to show the Highway Code 137 or 138 “Use the right-hand lane for overtaking or turning right. After overtaking, move back to the left-hand lane when it is safe to do so”. 

Too many people sit in the middle and third lane at 50 to 65 mph for no apparent reason when they should be in lane one. Too many drivers are unaware of motorway etiquette and should be fined.
